directions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt.
In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water and let it sit for 5 minutes until foamy.
Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and pour in the yeast mixture.
Stir until a dough forms, then knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a damp towel, and let it rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and shape it into a loaf.
Place the shaped dough on a greased baking sheet or in a greased loaf pan.
Cover the dough with a damp towel and let it rise again for 30-45 minutes.
Bake the bread for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped on the bottom.
Remove from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack before slicing.
